poem:
**Love in the Algorithm Age**

In the bright glare of the screen  
Pookie cradles luxury—a handbag's gleam—  
Push present gleaming like a new dawn,  
while Jett films affection, unflawed.  
The cosmos of codes and hearts entwine,  
clicking beyond algorithms,  
where love signs,  
in bytes and pixels, quietly reside.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Serial dating and push presents: love in the age of the algorithm is complex | Zandile Powell Sitting in a hospital bed, pregnant Campbell Puckett, known as “Pookie”, is handed a Craie Kelly Epsom 25 Hermès bag (retailing around £20,000) by her husband, Jett. “It’s time for her push present,” he says behind the camera. The husband and wife are arguably the internet’s favourite heterosexual couple at the moment, and if they are anything to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
